intro: Thelypteris santae-catharinae, commonly known as the Santa Catarina holly fern, is a species of fern native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, finely toothed margin. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, where it thrives in humid and cool conditions. Its rhizomes are short and produce dense clusters of leaves, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Thelypteris santae-catharinae is valued in horticulture for its elegant appearance and ability to adapt to shaded garden environments.
